Danone’s mission is Bringing health through food to as many people as possible and we want to invite people to join the movement for a healthier world. Corporate Lawyer, 1-5 year pqe Melbourne CBD office

Company Name Dentons Company Location Melbourne

Posted Date Posted 2 days ago Number of views 61 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

This role provides an excellent opportunity to be a key contributor to the successes of the corporate team. An exciting, diverse and hands on role with extensive and direct client access. Work with a team that has a flat structure, with excellent training and support and enormous potential for career and professional growth.

Dentons Australia

In Australia, Dentons has offices in Sydney, Melbourne and Perth, and associate offices in Brisbane and Adelaide, with more than 100 partners and over 800 staff. Our expertise, attitude and accessibility attract many of Australasia's most successful and innovative organisations as well as leading multinationals.

Our lawyers are repeatedly recognised as leading legal service providers in Chambers Global, Chambers Asia Pacific, The Legal 500 Asia Pacific and IFLR 1000. Many of our partners are consistently recognised in each of these directories and in Best Lawyers International: Australia. Dentons was again named the Lawyers weekly Diversity law firm of the year for a second year running.

The role

We are looking for a junior to mid level corporate lawyers with 1-5 years PQE who have relevant experience in corporate M&A transactions gained in a leading law firm or a well-respected boutique.

This role will see you advising Australian and international clients in a range of industry sectors. You will be involved in mergers and acquisitions (both domestic and cross border), IPOs and other fundraisings, advising clients on Corporations Act and Listing Rule compliance, foreign investment, joint ventures, major projects and managed funds.

Our corporate team is a supportive and inclusive environment with a flat structure, a great culture and employs a diverse range of professionals. You will be given the opportunity to work both autonomously as well as in a team. You will be supported in business development activities with regular opportunities for client contact and relationship building.

Dentons has established a number of professional development initiatives for technical training to support your career progression.

About you

You will be an energetic, team player who is keen to get involved in our exciting portfolio of growing work. You will work with a strong team of friendly and supportive lawyers, and will gain exposure to some cutting edge deals.

You will ideally have:
  • have 1-5 years PQE with significant time spent in a corporate team
  • have ECM and M&A experience
  • have excellent attention to detail
  • have superior drafting skills
  • be able to demonstrate a strong grasp of general commercial legal principles
  • develop client relationships with the support and guidance of partners
  • have the ability to work well autonomously and in a team
  • be self-motivated and enthusiastic
  • contribute positively to team culture

Employee Extras

Dentons Australia focuses on the three key areas of talent management: engagement, development, and culture to motivate, develop and deliver excellence for our clients.

We offer competitive market salary packaging, incentive pay and reward, salary sacrifice packaging, additional leave programs (purchased leave, parental leave) and referral bonuses.

We provide a number of corporate discounts, a generous health and wellbeing program and promote diversity initiatives across gender, flexibility, culture and LGBTI. We offer a range of benefits to our staff and their families. At Dentons, we are constantly looking to improve employee's lives in and out of the workplace.

As a Dentons employee you can also benefit from a range of free and discounted social activities, support networks, discounted gym memberships, discounted legal services and benefits on banking products with our clients.

To apply

Click on the below link to submit your application for this role. Please include a brief cover letter, current CV and academic transcripts. Alternatively, you can visit our Dentons career page.

Feel free to contact our Talent Manager, Bill Panourgias on + 61 2 9035 7458 with any questions regarding this opportunity. All enquiries will be treated with the strictest of confidence.

Dentons has an internal talent acquisition team that works directly with candidates on all of our career opportunities. Dentons does not accept external agency applications for this role.

Contact the job poster

Bill Panourgias

Talent Acquisition Manager at Dentons

Work Experience Applications

Company Name Manningham City Council Company Location Doncaster, AU

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 22 views

Be an early applicant

Job description


Does the Manningham City Council offer Work Experience?
A very limited number of Secondary School Students have the opportunity to obtain Work Experience at Manningham City Council (MCC) as part of their educational requirement. Students must apply in writing by answering the questions below and by attaching a cover letter and a resume to this application. The applications will then be forwarded to the relevant Unit Manager who will decide if the student's request can be accommodated.


What type of students are eligible to participate in the Manningham’s Work Experience Program?
MCC’s Work Experience Program is available only to secondary school students provided that it forms part of their education program.


How will you be advised if I have received an offer?
MCC receives a large number of work experience/work placement applications. Unfortunately we are only able to accommodate a handful of those applications due to a number of reasons.
If you are successful, you will hear from us within 15 working days after the submission of your application.

If you do not hear from us during the above period please consider your application as unsuccessful.

If a placement can be offered, will I be paid during work experience?
Secondary school students receive a minimum payment of $15 a day, under the Victorian Work Experience Arrangement.

What areas of work can we possibly offer?
Administration, Childcare, Function Centre Support, Information Technology, Health & Local Laws and Human Resources

Carlton & United Breweries (CUB) is one of Australia’s most iconic companies. We are a part of AB InBev, the largest and only truly global brewer selling over 400 brands across 100 markets and employing 200,000 people. Our Dream is to bring people together for a better world. We are committed to driving growth that leads to better living for more people in more places and focussed on bringing people and cultures together through our brands and experiences.

At CUB, our greatest strength is our people. We recruit people who can be better than ourselves and retain people by allowing them to grow at their own pace, providing training opportunities and offering a safe environment where they will be rewarded for their contributions.

Job description

In Private & Relationship Banking we recognise that our client's time and personal wealth is important to them, so we take the time to understand their personal goals, fast track their requests and deliver key insights and opportunities to them. We do this through aligning our activities to our strategic values of sustainable growth, customer experience, people & culture and simplicity, whilst ensuring that at all times we own and manage risk, which is a part of the Bankwest DNA.

Private Banking in VIC is currently seeking the services of an experienced Private Client Manager to manage a mature portfolio of existing clients, generate new to bank opportunities and contribute positively to the development of junior staff and the culture of the business. This role is critical to the success of Private Banking VIC and to recognise this you will be part of a transparent incentive payment scheme.

Key Responsibilities Of a Private Client Manager Include
  • Proactively maintaining a portfolio of clients;

Job description

  • Full-time Ongoing position

About Us

The Transport Accident Commission (TAC) is a Victorian Government-owned organisation. The role of the TAC is to promote road safety through the Towards Zero road deaths and serious injuries strategy, improve the State's trauma system and support those who have been injured on our roads.


TAC Benefits

We offer a range of exciting benefits, including:

  • Flexible work arrangements
  • Health and wellbeing services, including onsite doctor, flu vaccinations, fresh fruit and subsidised gym memberships
  • Access to our annual bonus scheme and rewards and recognition programme
  • Social club membership
  • Employee referral and study assistance programmes
  • Salary packaging options, including extra super contributions and novated leasing
  • Recognition of prior service in the public sector for the purposes of LSL


About the Role

If you have commenced a career in Data Science and would like to step into a fantastic role to continue progressing, this could be the role for you.

You would be responsible for supporting the Data Science Practice team in building on the foundation for a Data Science practice to provide high-impact insights and recommendations to the TAC’s Executive and Senior Leadership Team.

Key responsibilities include but are not limited to:

  • Acquiring, managing, understanding and preparing data for explorative and predictive analysis.
  • Developing Proof of Concept solutions in a fast and effective way, using appropriate techniques and software.
  • Training others in the use of advanced data science techniques/software and facilitate projects where these are applied.

\xa0

About You

Job description

Working at Pitcher Partners gives you greater control of your career.

Our mission is to be the middle market’s preeminent accounting and advisory firm – building strong long-term relationships with our people and clients to nurture and support their needs and development.

We understand that people underpin our success – that’s why we provide a flexible and supportive environment enabling our teams to excel. We’ll encourage you to forge a career path that prepares you for today while positioning you for the future.

\xa0

Your new role

This is a broad role which primarily assists in the day to day management of risk across a large and diverse firm of over 700 employees.\xa0 The role also includes quality control and compliance functions.\xa0 The diversity in the role presents an opportunity to develop and grow your career and is perfect for a risk specialist seeking a generalist role or development opportunity or first movers from an internal or external audit role.

The responsibilities of this role include:

  • Developing and monitoring the firm’s Risk Management Framework by conducting comprehensive risk reviews of divisional risk registers and providing feedback to divisional partners and the Risk Committee.
  • Working closely with the wider business to risk assess matters as they arise and to implement controls that support the business commercially.
  • Assisting with the interpretation of laws and non-technical accounting standards that affect the firm and participating in the development of policies, procedures and training and the testing of associated controls.

  • Interpreting changes in legislation, conducting file reviews, maintaining compliance registers, conducting applicable compliance functions, dealing with regulators and professional bodies and monitoring the controls environment.

Our environment offers flexibility to suit your individual needs and we encourage you to develop and maintain a balanced lifestyle as we recognise that healthy, happy and engaged staff work better and smarter.\xa0

Job description

As the world’s only integrated Technology Company spanning the entire energy conversion chain, Siemens works across all business and technology interfaces with an integrated portfolio of products, solutions and services. Our breadth of offerings from power generation, transmission and distribution, along with our proven expertise, allows us to provide end-to-end energy solutions to meet the growing needs of the local market.

We currently have a new opportunity for an experienced Principal Consultant Power System to join our Energy Management Division in Digital Grid Business Unit - Power Technologies International (PTI) team. Based in our Melbourne, VIC office, the successful candidate will have the opportunity to work within an area of the Siemens business that has enormous market potential.

Reporting to the Country PTI Manager, the Principal Consultant Power System will be required to visit internal and external customers to develop business opportunities for the Digital Grid business unit across Australia. They will then be required to leverage technical electrical studies, including also new market trends like MicroGrids, Remote Monitoring, Remote Maintenance etc.., identify local market requirements and leverage technical solutions in contact with other Business Units, Business Segments and Headquarters, and create market demand for our solution, including develop and present to customers and possible stakeholders our solution business cases, including financial aspects like ROI, CAPEx vs. OPEX, etc.

Once these opportunities have been identified you will then be required to write solution specifications and develop operation philosophies to enforce Siemens position in selling process, as well as understanding and clarifying customer requirements, whilst then driving those expectations into Siemens technical concepts and expertises. In addition you will need to prepare offers, including cost calculations, and define delivery concepts of our solutions, create respective technical and commercial concepts and offerings, in order to support the sales process, and support BU organization in contract negotiations at all stages, with information and analyses.

In order to be considered for this opportunity you will need and understanding of the following:

  • Planning, design, operation and maintenance of electricity networks
  • Large generation and load connection studies including assessment of dynamic behaviour, control system assessments, Protection Coordination studies and tuning of parameters
  • Undertake power system studies relating to Steady state, dynamic, transient, power quality and small signal power system performance on transmission and distribution networks including microgrids
  • Load flow and dynamic simulation experience using PSSE, PSSSINCAL, Digsilent Powerfactory and other simulation tools
  • Experience in developing PSSE, Digsilent Powerfactory scripts
  • Solid competency in report writing with proficient interpersonal, communication and negotiation skills
  • Broad knowledge of transmission system plant and its application, including the planning criteria, specifications and design requirements
  • Excellent communication & presentation skills
  • Undertake the connection negotiations including GPS studies with AEMO and TNSPs/DNSPs for Solar Farms & Wind Farms in line with Nation Electricity rules (NER).
  • Produce high quality reports documenting study findings, results and recommendations.
  • Undertake the Project Manager role for the studies to be delivered to customers
  • Review access application data and computer models, including detailed assessment of computer models against the requirements of relevant technical standards
  • Produce high quality reports documenting study findings, results and recommendations.
  • Have expert knowledge of high-reliability commercial/industrial battery and power systems
  • Ability to manage several project concurrently with projects ranging from less than a week out to 12 months in duration

    • The successful candidate will be an Engineer who has a specialization in electrical power systems (generation, distribution, transmission grids) and/or industrial automation, and can lead offer preparations, including cost calculation and T&Cs negotiation. You will be able to demonstrate your ability to deliver systems or solutions for energy markets, be comfortable working as part of a highly motivated project execution team, and ideally have an in depth knowledge of the Australian energy market place.

    If you are a dynamic Electrical Engineering specialist looking for a new challenge with a global technology leader, then this role is a great career opportunity. In return, we offer a rewarding team environment, a commitment to your ongoing learning and development, and an attractive salary package.

Job description

We are currently seeking an experienced Business Systems Advisor for the West Gate Tunnel Project

About CPBJH JV

CPBJH JV brings together two of Australia's leading construction partners, CPB Contractors and John Holland, with unparalleled expertise in large-scale and complex project management, civil construction, traffic management and tunnelling.

The West Gate Tunnel is a partnership between the Victorian Government and Transurban. The Joint Venture has been chosen as the preferred contractor for construction, which began in early 2018 following planning assessment.

About The Project

The West Gate Tunnel Project is a city-shaping project that will deliver a vital alternative to the West Gate Bridge, provide quicker and safer journeys, and remove thousands of trucks off residential streets. The project will include:
  • Widening the West Gate Freeway from eight lanes to 12 between the M80 Ring Road and Williamstown Road;
  • Building a 2.8km eastbound tunnel and a 4km westbound tunnel under Yarraville;
  • Constructing a bridge over the Maribyrnong River providing an alternative to the West Gate Bridge;
  • Constructing an elevated road along Footscray Road to the Port of Melbourne; and
  • Major new cycling and pedestrian paths.

Business Systems Advisor

To assist in the management and implementation of all systems, technologies and applications on the Project, ensuring alignment with statutory and contractual compliance.

Position Responsibilities
  • Provide advice to Project employees on internal plans and systems. Assist with implementation of and training on systems and processes. Keep up to date records of users and super users. Facilitate ICT support to the Project.
  • Assist in completing compliance statements to the appropriate standard in a timely manner.
  • Provide ongoing training to wider Project team on current and new systems being implemented. Keep records of training delivered and training materials.

It will give you an opportunity to demonstrate your cyber tradecraft to the Cyber Defence staff to pass on the skills you have learned in previous roles. You will be also responsible for the development of system, processes and capability to meet strategic objectives as well as building relationships both internally and externally to increase the brand and reputation of Telstra Cyber Security.
  • Rotational on call 24X7 with incident management duties
  • Development and maintenance of a suitable training regime
  • Perform first-in-fix where possible.
  • Engage external stakeholders to mitigate/resolve where required
  • Ensure incidents are meeting all KPIs
  • Identify opportunities to tune the Detection capability to reduce false-positives.
  • Develop and maintain reporting metrics and mechanisms used to execute and measure SOC activities
  • Continuously improve security incident response plans
  • Act as owner of the managed security service and provide internal escalation for your team members
  • Work collaboratively with our client services organization, security service advisors, professional services, sales and any other teams involved in delivery of the SOC service.
  • Contribute to pursuing cohesion, performance, and leadership as well as service improvement.
  • Regular and ongoing governance of service delivery including reporting, analysis, recommendations for improvements and follow-up, you will nurture working relationships with customers and key stakeholders


What We Are Looking For

To be successful in this role, you will have the following experience and qualifications:
  • Minimum 5 years’ experience in Cyber Security in a technical domain
  • Experience working at Government security agencies are desirable though not mandatory.
  • Relevant Cyber Security qualifications and working experience as Pen Tester or Red Team are highly regarded
  • Please note due to the nature of the role, successful candidate must be an Australian citizen with ability to obtain and maintain a Federal Government security clearance.


Benefits And Career Path

Working for the most successful Telco Company in Australia also brings with it some great benefits, including: Working with the top IT Specialists in the APAC Region who provide support and mentoring, Substantial discounts on a range of Telstra products (including FOXTEL), Financial benefits such as Telstra Share Options, Great Salary Packaging Options and discounts on various retail, health and fitness and entertainment areas, Excellent work/life balance that allows you to have an excellent divide of personal needs and work commitments and performance bonuses*. Check out our website for more information and testimonials from our Employees.

We’re committed to building a diverse and inclusive workforce. To enable everyone to participate, we’ve developed an ‘All Roles Flex’ policy to consider flexible ways of working for every role. To learn more, visit

  • Online Media
  • Telecommunications

[

Placement Manager - Health & Benefits

Company Name Aon Company Location Sydney

Posted Date Posted 1 day ago Number of views 27 views

Be an early applicant

Job description

The Opportunity We are looking for two highly motivated and professional individuals to take on Placement Manager positions, one focused primarily on Accident & Health, the other on Group Life risk. You will be part of a multi-disciplined Placement team, supporting Aon’s Health & Benefits team. Reporting directly to a Placement Director you will work closely with a team of colleagues with specialist knowledge in Accident and Health, Group Life and Private Health insurance. You could work out of either the Sydney or the Melbourne office.

You will be responsible for:

  • Manage the marketing and placement of a portfolio of corporate Health & Benefits (H&B) programs with a focus on Accident & Health or Group Life encompassing all elements of insurance program marketing from client strategy, insurer negotiation, technical analysis and presentation of results.
  • Partner with client managers and executives to set renewal program strategy and objectives for client programs and place the program with insurers on an annual basis (or as otherwise determined).
  • Represent both Aon and our clients’ interests with the local markets and negotiate favourable coverage pricing and terms.
  • Build and maintain positive relationships with key personnel within local insurance markets.
  • Oversight and supervise the placement of programs via the Aon facility, encouraging proper adherence to Aon’s ‘go-to-market’ strategy, by client managers / support staff.
  • Monitor insurance markets to maintain up to date knowledge of competitiveness.

To be successful, you will demonstrate:
  • In-depth knowledge of the corporate A&H/ Group Life market.
  • Demonstrated expertise with insurance programs of large and complex A&H/ Group Life insurance programs.
  • Experience working with and/or for insurers in disciplines such as pricing, underwriting, distribution and technical.
  • Experience managing cross-functional projects with solid ability to manage multiple priorities and balance competing deadlines
  • Exceptional communication and stakeholder management skills with outstanding negotiation and influencing skills
  • RG146 Certification in: General Insurance Broking and/ or, Life and superannuation will be viewed favourably

This is an opportunity for an Underwriter to transition into a market-facing broking role or a broker to shift their focus away from the client and more towards carrier management. It is an exciting opportunity to make this newly-created role your own.

Aon Culture & Benefits
 With close to 1600 employees, we are the largest organisation of our kind in Australia. Globally, we have an employee base of 69,000 people working across 120 countries. This allows us to gather the best thinking from around the world and deliver solutions locally. We provide colleagues with the support to make an impact, a team that will inspire you to achieve, and on-going opportunities for development.

How to Apply
 Make your mark and apply online today.
Aon is an equal opportunity employer and we invite you to be part of an organisation that has a diverse workplace, values continuous learning and supports many charities and environmental initiatives.

Job description

  • Immediate start to end of November

The Organisation


Iconic Australian luxury retailer whose portfolio includes renowned international and national brands. Their employees love working there as they feel trusted to perform their role, they enjoy the collaborative environment and they have a clear sense of the business direction.


The Opportunity


They require an immediately available Recruitment Consultant to deliver on high volume store-based roles. This is a two-three month contract.


Specifically, you will:

  • Carry out job briefs, draft job ads, CV screening, phone screens, manage offer process etc,
  • Partner with the Talent Acquisition Manager to define general candidate requirements (prior experience, required skills, education, compensation ranges etc),
  • Use internal recruiting system PageUp to track progress against plans and adjust as required,
  • Work in a fast-paced environment where you will deal with high volume recruitment.


To Be Successful you will:

  • Be available to start immediately,
  • Have experience in high volume recruitment within either an internal or agency environment,
  • be able to multi-task, prioritise effectively and work within a fast-paced environment,
  • Have experience with web-based recruitment systems such as PageUp.
